data.title: Awesome place for food and desserts
data.text: We stopped in for a snack after my daughter got out of school and we had the BEST banana split. We also got some fresh bread pudding to go. I remember visiting the Model Pharmacy growing up and it has not changed. The young woman working behind the counter was so nice and helpful while we tried to make up our mind. When a person finds a place like this they must tell everyone they can. I hope my daughter takes her kids there when she grows up. Pictures do it no justice, you must try it.

data.title: A throwback to last century
data.text: This was a visit to the past - a combo of pharmacy, general store, and a diner. We came here for lunch. The food was good, service excellent and atmosphere to spare. This place sells everything from fancy chocolates to luxury leather goods to tchotchkes to drugs and food. Definitely one of a kind.

data.title: One-of-a-kind retro eatery
data.text:
The first time I went to Model Pharmacy, to meet a friend for lunch, I couldn't believe it. Reminds me of the old-time drugstore where my granddad used to take me for a soda. Except this place has really good sandwiches, homemade deserts, retro-type merchandise for sale (like genuine perfume for women and shaving brushes for men), and a funky-fun ambience. 

If I could, I'd rate it 4.5. Just don't quite believe it's exactly a "5." Pretty close though, for the kind of place it is.

data.title: Friendly service, good food
data.text: This is a small neighborhood restaurant situated in an upscale small drugstore/pharmacy. It is a fun and cozy place to eat. The workers were delightful and after my husband and I shared 2 different sandwiches and school was out, we came back with our 9 year old grandson, sat at the counter, and thoroughly enjoyed old fashioned ice cream sodas and sundaes.

data.title: Excellent sandwiches at a retro soda shoppe with a neat stuff attached
data.text:
This place was very cool, there was a whole soda shoppe and ice cream fountain counter inside, along with several small tables for lunch. We ordered sandwiches for lunch, they were delicious and a perfect portion (not huge) and enjoyed the ambiance of the old-style pharmacy and the collection of mobiles hanging from the ceiling. Very reasonable prices. Saw several older couple and friends having lunch who looked like they might have been coming to this place for a long time... ☺

Would definitely come back here for lunch.

data.title: A Step Back in Time!
data.text: What a fun place to go for lunch. This is like an old fashioned soda fountain at a drug store. It isn't much of a pharmacy any longer....but sells high end hair fashions, hard to find perfumes and loads of unique shaving items. The cafe part of the building is quaint. There's a counter or tables to sit at. The menu offers a nice array of sandwiches, a daily soup and some salads all at a reasonable price. And the root beer float is to die for.

data.title: Quirky, solid lunch if you are in the neighborhood
data.text: I think the people that love Model Pharmacy remember a time when every town had a pharmacy with a lunch counter and love the nostalgia. The "restaurant" was certainly unique, homey and welcoming. Most of the customers seemed to be regulars. The employees were especially pleasant and helpful. The menu consisted of a nice variety basic sandwiches and soups and the food quality was solid, if not exciting. The best part of the menu was dessert, although my daughter complained that her milkshake was thin. The  cobbler was great. The portion sizes were not much more than school-lunch sized, which should be enough food for lunch, but the prices seemed high for what we got. We spent $60 for four sandwiches, a milkshake and two desserts (no beverages). If you are in the neighborhood, hungry and interested in nostalgia, you should stop by. But this is not some place to go out of your way to visit unless you are also interested in the esoteric pharmacy options like the huge variety of old-fashioned men's shaving accessories and exotic soaps and lotions.

data.title: Authentic drugstore soda fountain
data.text: I have eaten at the Model Pharmacy many times over the years (I only live five doors down the street) and have always enjoyed the experience. The soups and sandwiches are always freshly prepared and delicious. The daily special is always worth a look.

data.title: Great, unique dining and delicious ice cream
data.text: This is a great, old fashioned pharmacy with a variety of ice cream products, sodas, sandwiches and more.  The food is great.  The atmosphere is great.  And the pharmacy has a lot of great, unique items, including a wide variety of shaving products.

data.title: A Darling Find for Lunch
data.text:
Model Pharmacy  peals back the clock 50 years to a time when soda jerks abounded and sandwiches were especially tasty with lettuce, tomatoes, mayo………old fashioned things.  Think home baked fresh fruit cobblers, root beer floats, black & white tile floors 
with plastic tabletops.  Imagine 50-75 whirling paper hangings over your head of airplanes, children animal themes that you can buy if you want.  In the next room is the charming pharmacy gift area where you can get Expensive European perfumes or inexpensive bath soaps you don't see anywhere else or Swiss lipstick.  I am charmed by the place……a not fancy but reminiscent of days gone by.

data.title: Great place for lunch
data.text: My husband and I had lunch here while in Albuquerque. It is a really cute soda shop and lunch restaurant.  We both got chocolate malts (which were huge we should have shared). I got the quiche with a side salad it was good. My husband got the Ruben and said that it was one of the best he has ever had. I highly recommend getting lunch here.

data.title: Old-fashioned chocolate shake/malt with vanilla ice cream!
data.text: This is one of the few places in town that still makes and serves their shakes & malts the old-fashioned way.  They give you the ice-cold metal container with the ice cream treat at the bottom in addition to the tall glass with the whipped cream on top. Mmmmmm... Love it!   Also they have lots of delicious sandwiches to choose from with a variety of good vegetarian options.  They always give you a little cup of spiced apple sauce which is so tasty.  Love the old-fashioned soda shop look and feel.  Plus you get to browse though their excellent (albeit expensive) gift shop with unique greeting cards, perfumes, soaps, jewelry, hair accessories and all kinds of other things.  A great choice to go by yourself or with a friend or family member.  Tables are small and space is limited so it's not the optimal choice for a group of more than 3 or 4 unless you go very early.

data.title: step back in time...
data.text:
Soda fountain and seating
Locals are known by name
Drug store with finds of days gone by
Breakfast and lunch
Had the soup and sandwich deal 
So Good!

data.title: love it!
data.text:
simple and clean, regular ol' good diner food with friendly waitresses and homemade everything!
Really cool selections of old time pharmacy products next door.

data.title: Model Lunch Hangout
data.text: If you have nostalgia for malts, cobblers, hearty sandwiches and delicious soups, then this is your hangout heaven. My favorite is the ham, brie on baguette with blackberry mustard. Then there is dessert! But for grand mom, mom and your aunt, the after lunch browsing is the most fun. Rare perfumes imported from Europe. Everything to beautify one is there. Plus, they have cards, writing paper, etc. And yes, they have a pharmacy too, with imported soaps, razors, etc. It is an experience. Go.

data.title: Vegetarians can eat here!!
data.text: I always try to eat here whenever I visit Albuquerque. This lunch was no exception to the delicious sandwiches, soup and DESSERT I've had in the past. The vegeburger comes with a side salad. And the dessert was fabulous!!

data.title: Quirky Albuquerque
data.text: I haven't been to Model since I was in college (a really long time ago) and what is hilarious is that it hasn't changed a BIT.  Well, I think all the mobiles hanging from the ceiling are new, and the food is better than I remember.  The kiddo had a turkey and swiss on a baguette, which she said was too dry, but they had a small serving of apple sauce on the plate that she creatively used to make the sandwich taste better.  And the reuben was delicious.  And of course the chocolate mint shake was awesome.  But what makes this a solid 4 stars is the quintessential "Albuquerque-ness" of the place.  Where else can you get a soda fountain drink, lunch (a good lunch), a couple of chocolate truffles to go, pick up your prescription, and spend 30 mins smelling all the perfume and soaps and picking through the fabulous hair accessories?  It's quirky, just like my adorable little city.

data.title: Very friendly & helpful staff. Lots of different sundries
data.text: The salads, sandwiches and soups are exceptional .  The hair accessories are the best in the city. lots of made from scratch menu items.

data.title: Don't go 5 min before closing
data.text:
We have tried and failed 2 times to get to this place. We read the reviews and have been craving an old fashion soda fountain... Today we had an opportunity to go before they closed-check hours, they close before dinner. We made it to the door at 4:54p and were so excited for fountain soda. The lady came promptly to the door as we walked up and stated "sorry, we're closed". She shut the door on us and locked it as we were standing there. Quite deflated and quite sad. 

Well, unfortunately we will not be attempting another trip. We are very disappointed in this experience of customer service.

data.title: Nice change of pace
data.text:
After driving by here umpteen times over the past 10 years and thinking "I have to go there" I finally did, with a friend who was born and raised in ABQ and had never been here. 
What an interesting place! So much variety in such a small space. 
The diner is a step back in time. Typical soda fountain fare plus a mice selection of sandwiches, etc. I had the Reuben and was not disappointed. It was excellent. The peach cobbler was a bit off the mark. The biscuit was a tad doughy but the peaches were just right. 
Aftern lunch I bought a classic men's cologne not easy to find any more. Extensive "scents" are just part of the eclectic choices at Model. 
Worth a visit.
